title: oprseq/nanoflow
description: Virus metagenomics nanopore sequencing analysis workflow

input.title: Input Options
input.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

fastq.title: FASTQ
fastq.description: FASTQ files to use in the analysis.
fastq.help_text: This accepts one of three cases: (i) the path to a single FASTQ file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing FASTQ files; (iii) the path to a directory containing one level of sub-directories which in turn contain FASTQ files. In the first and second case, a sample name can be supplied with `--sample`. In the last case, the data is assumed to be multiplexed with the names of the sub-directories as barcodes. In this case, a sample sheet can be provided with `--sample_sheet`.

out_dir.title: Output directory
out_dir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.
out_dir.help_text: The directory where all workflow outputs will be saved. Accepts absolute or relative paths.

trim_length.title: Trim length
trim_length.description: Number of bases to trim from the start of each read.
trim_length.help_text: The number of nts to remove from the start of each read. This is useful for removing adapter sequences or other unwanted bases.

virus_db.title: Database directory
virus_db.help_text: The directory containing the virus databases used filtering, read classification and blast-searches.

centrifuge_classification_libraries.title: Centrifuge classification libraries
centrifuge_classification_libraries.help_text: The Centrifuge classification libraries to use for classification of reads. The index files are in the virus database directory and end with cf.

contamination_filters.title: Contamination filters
contamination_filters.help_text: minimap2 is used to map the reads against these contaminants. Reads that map are filtered out.

contamination_databases.title: Contamination Databases
contamination_databases.description: Paths to contamination databases used for filtering.
contamination_databases.help_text: Dictionary mapping contamination database types to their file paths. Paths are constructed using the `virus_db` directory.

analyse_unclassified.title: Analyse unclassified reads
analyse_unclassified.description: Analyse unclassified reads from input directory. By default the workflow will not process reads in the unclassified directory.
analyse_unclassified.help_text: If selected and if the input is a multiplex directory the workflow will also process the unclassified directory.

samples.title: Sample Options
samples.description: Parameters that relate to samples such as sample sheets and sample names.

sample_sheet.title: Sample sheet
sample_sheet.description: A CSV file used to map barcodes to sample aliases. The sample sheet can be provided when the input data is a directory containing sub-directories with FASTQ files.
sample_sheet.help_text: The sample sheet is a CSV file with, minimally, columns named `barcode` and `alias`. Extra columns are allowed. A `type` column is required for certain workflows and should have the following values; `test_sample`, `positive_control`, `negative_control`, `no_template_control`.

output.title: Output Options
output.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.title: Output directory
out_dir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Advanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.
advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

reference.title: Reference FASTA
reference.description: Enter the full path to a custom reference genome you would like to use.
reference.help_text: The workflow defaults to the IRMA consensus reference. This option allows you to specify a path to an alternative reference.

blastdb.title: Typing BLAST Database
blastdb.help_text: The workflow provides the INSaFLU blastdb. If you would like to supply an alternative then provide the full path to the file here.

min_coverage.title: Minimum depth coverage
min_coverage.description: Coverage threshold for masking bases in the consensus.
min_coverage.help_text: Any bases that are covered below 20x are masked (i.e. represented by 'N') by default in the consensus, this threshold can be changed using this parameter.

min_qscore.title: Minimum read Q-score
min_qscore.description: Minimum read quality score for fastcat.
min_qscore.help_text: Any reads which are below quality score of 9 are not used by default. This parameter allows you to customise that. For more information on quality scores please see this blog post: https://labs.epi2me.io/quality-scores

downsample.title: Downsampling read threshold
downsample.description: Number of reads to downsample to in each direction, leave blank for no downsampling.
downsample.help_text: The workflow for each segment will first filter reads to include only those that are ±10% of the segment length before downsampling to the specified integer (taking an even split from forward and reverse reads). This downsampled data is then used in variant calling.

medaka_consensus_model.title: Medaka consensus model
medaka_consensus_model.description: The name of a Medaka model to use. By default the workflow will select an appropriate Medaka model from the basecaller configuration provided. Entering a name here will override the automated selection and use the Medaka model named here.
medaka_consensus_model.help_text: The workflow will attempt to map the basecalling model used to a suitable Medaka consensus model. You can override this by providing a model with this option instead.

rbk.title: rbk
rbk.description: Set when using data created with the RBK protocol.
rbk.help_text: This prevents shorter reads being filtered out and also turns off downsampling as this is not appropriate for the shorter reads generated with RBK.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.
